item.title: West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center Preservation Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6269)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6268-6269)

summary.text:
West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center Preservation Act of 2007 - Prohibits the Secretary of Veterans Affairs from declaring as excess to the needs of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), or otherwise disposing or reducing the acreage of, federal land and improvements at the West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center, California.

Directs the Secretary to: (1) submit to the congressional veterans and appropriations committees a master plan for the use of such land and improvements; and (2) appoint an advisory committee to advise in developing the master plan.

bill.title: West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center Preservation Act of 2007

item.title: West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center Preservation Act of 2007

A bill to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to submit a report to Congress providing a master plan for the use of the West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center, California, and for other purposes.
West Los Angeles Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center Preservation Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6269)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
